Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラ
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: <Agarte>
Entry.EnglishText: <Agarte>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラの家
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla's House

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド村・<unk18:48D00480>
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado Village - <unk18:48D00480>

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたが…… ナイラさん……？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you... Nayla?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。私がナイラですが、 どのようなご用件でしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, I am. Can I help you with something?

Entry.JapaneseText: これと同じものを使う占い師が、 ここにいるって……
Entry.EnglishText: We were told that a fortune teller in possession of cards similar to these resided here.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたなのね？
Entry.EnglishText: Would that happen to be you?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あ、あなた…… 一体、これをどこで……？
Entry.EnglishText: Where... Where on earth did you get those cards?

Entry.JapaneseText: 知らないわ…… それを知るために、 ここに来たのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know. That's what I came here to find out.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あ、あなた…… お名前は？
Entry.EnglishText: What... What is your name?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Hilda>。
Entry.EnglishText: ...<Hilda>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もしかして、あなた…… ……ハーフ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you by any chance... a Half?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうしてそれを!?
Entry.EnglishText: How would you know that?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……やっぱり…… <Hilda>……<Hilda>…… 生きていたのね……
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>...it really is you! You're alive...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……何よ……？ どういう事……？
Entry.EnglishText: Excuse me? What are you talking about?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>……私が…… 私が……あなたの母親よ……
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>, I... I'm your mother...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたが……私の母親……
Entry.EnglishText: My mother...?

Entry.JapaneseText: い、いきなりビンゴかよ…… よかったな、<Hilda>!!
Entry.EnglishText: Kinda crazy for the stars to align like that, but... That's great news, <Hilda>!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>……私の<Hilda>…… あなたの顔を、よく見せて……
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>... My dear <Hilda>... Let me take a look at you...

Entry.JapaneseText: ふたつの角を…… 頂く女……
Entry.EnglishText: A woman with two horns...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何するの!!
Entry.EnglishText: What are you doing?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……今すぐ……この村から…… 出ていきなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: Leave this village...at once...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……えっ…… 何ですって……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? Why are you...?

Entry.JapaneseText: そう……出ていきなさい…… ……出ていって……!!
Entry.EnglishText: You heard me. I said leave... Get the hell out of here!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何よ？ どういう事……!?
Entry.EnglishText: What? What's the meaning of this...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ハーフの娘なんて…… 見たくもないわ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: A Half isn't worth laying eyes on, even if you are my daughter!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そう……そうよね…… 私は……
Entry.EnglishText: Right... Of course. I...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>さん……
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ふふっ……私がバカだった…… 私は、あんたに一度、 見捨てられてるんだもんね。
Entry.EnglishText: Haha... I'm such an idiot. I was already abandoned by you once, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私は今までずっと、 両親はいないものだって、 自分に言い聞かせてきた……
Entry.EnglishText: My whole life until now, I had convinced myself that I never had any parents...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてだかわかる？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Do you know why?

Entry.JapaneseText: そのほうが、 少しは哀しい気持ちになる、 少しは憎しみも弱くなる、 そんな気がしたからよ。
Entry.EnglishText: So that my hatred would fade away into sadness... or so I thought.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……本当にバカよね…… 私も……
Entry.EnglishText: But I was a fool. I...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今すぐ…… 私の前から消えて……
Entry.EnglishText: Get out of my sight... Now.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……言われなくても、 出ていくわよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have to tell me twice. I'm out of here!

Entry.JapaneseText: どういう事なんだよ!? さっきの涙は何だったんだよ!?
Entry.EnglishText: What is your problem? Were those tears earlier just for show?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すみません。 出ていってください……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry. Please leave...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>を……あの子を連れて…… すぐにこの村から！
Entry.EnglishText: Just get <Hilda> out of this village!

Entry.JapaneseText: 待ってくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Now just hold on!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>が心配だ。 今はあいつを……！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm worried about <Hilda>. We need to go check on her.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>さん……
Entry.EnglishText: Here, <Hilda>...

Entry.JapaneseText: これは……？
Entry.EnglishText: What's this?

Entry.JapaneseText: もし、自分が死んだ後、 娘が来るような事があったら、 これを渡して欲しいって……
Entry.EnglishText: Your mother asked me to give this to you in case you arrived here after she passed away.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私みたいなおばあさんに お願いするなんてヘンよねぇ…… まるで、自分が死ぬのが わかってたみたい……
Entry.EnglishText: I did find it strange that she would entrust this task to an old lady like myself... It's almost as though she knew she was going to die.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>…… どこかへとさらわれていった あなたが……
Entry.EnglishText: "To my dear <Hilda>, who was stolen away from me..."

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ここを訪ねてきてくれた時の ために、この手紙を残します。
Entry.EnglishText: "...I've written this letter for you in case you ever found your way here."

Entry.JapaneseText: やっとあなたがここへ来てくれたのに、 直接謝る事ができなくて、 本当にごめんなさい。
Entry.EnglishText: "I am truly sorry that I will never be able to apologize to you in person, even after you've come all this way."

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマのお父さん……アムジルと ガジュマの私の間に生まれたあなたが、 自分の身体の事でいつか苦しむだろう事は 予想していました。
Entry.EnglishText: "You were born from the union between myself, a Gajuma, and your Huma father, Amzil. We did this despite knowing that someday your body would bring you suffering."

Entry.JapaneseText: それでも、私たちはあなたを生みました。 私たちが見つけた愛のすばらしさに、 生命を吹き込み、喜びを分かち合うためです ……あなたと。
Entry.EnglishText: "Nevertheless, we still had you. The wonders of the love that we had found brought forth a new life that we could share our happiness with... And that life was you."

Entry.JapaneseText: ハーフと呼ばれ、忌み嫌われる その身体を、あなたは呪い、 私たちを恨んでいるかもしれません。
Entry.EnglishText: "Perhaps you would grow to hate us and curse the body we have given you, one which some would call the loathsome body of a Half..."

Entry.JapaneseText: でもあなたは、私たちの誇りです。
Entry.EnglishText: "But, <Hilda>, you are our pride and joy."

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたはハーフなんかじゃない。 半分なんかじゃない……
Entry.EnglishText: "What you are is not a Half. Why, you're not "half" of anything.

Entry.JapaneseText: お父さんと私のふたつの命を 併せ持つ存在だからです……
Entry.EnglishText: Because your existence was brought forth by the combination of two lives: your father's and my own.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから……胸を張って生きてください。 ヒューマでもガジュマでもハーフでもない ……<Yellow>ヒト<White>として。
Entry.EnglishText: So please, live life with your head held high. Not as a Huma, or as a Gajuma, or as a Half. But as a <Yellow>Human<White> being.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>ヒト<White>として…… あなたの母、ナイラ…… 私の……愛する……<Hilda>……
Entry.EnglishText: As a <Yellow>Human<White> being... "To my beloved <Hilda>, from your mother, Nayla..."

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なによ……こんな手紙……
Entry.EnglishText: Just what is this letter...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ふたつの角を頂く女……
Entry.EnglishText: A woman with two horns...

Entry.JapaneseText: 「寄る辺なき者たちが集いし北の村で、 ふたつの角を頂く女、 古き星をその手に掴む時、 天命尽き大地に還る」……
Entry.EnglishText: "In a northern village where the forsaken gather, a woman with two horns on her head and the olden stars in her hands shall meet her fate and return to the earth."

Entry.JapaneseText: これって、ナイラさんの字かしら？ なんだか、ナイラさんの事を暗示 しているように思えるんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Is this Nayla's handwriting? I'm under the impression that this refers to Nayla, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 古き星って、タロットの事だろ？ <Hilda>とも言えなくないか？
Entry.EnglishText: The "ancient stars" refers to the Tarot Cards, right? Couldn't that also apply to Hilda?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ナイラさんは自分の死を、 占いで予言してたんじゃない でしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: Could it be that Nayla had foreseen her own death through her Tarot readings...?

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、突然現れた<Hilda>さんも 自分と同じ古いタロットを持っていて、 「ふたつの角を頂く女」だと気づいた。
Entry.EnglishText: But when <Hilda> had suddenly showed up in possession of the same cards, she realized who the "woman with two horns" really was.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だから、ナイラさんは <Hilda>のタロットを 破り捨てたという事か？
Entry.EnglishText: Could that be why Nayla destroyed <Hilda>'s cards?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……その上で<Hilda>を拒み、 予言が果たされるこの村を去るように 仕向けたんだろう……
Entry.EnglishText: That had to have been why. Nayla rejected <Hilda> to get her to leave the village where the prophecy would have been fulfilled.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だったら何よ…… 私の身代わりになって死ぬなんて、 どうかしてるわ……
Entry.EnglishText: But... To go so far as to die in my place... What was she thinking...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 私が望んでいたのは…… こんな手紙でも、 命を救ってもらう事でもない!!
Entry.EnglishText: What I wanted wasn't some letter, or for someone to save my life!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私が欲しかったのは…… あの人に言いたかったのは……
Entry.EnglishText: What I really wanted... I just wanted to say to her...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私……一度もあの人の事、 お母さんって呼んだ事なかった……
Entry.EnglishText: I just... I never got the chance to call her mother...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……お母さん……お母さん……
Entry.EnglishText: Mother... Mother...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラの家
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla's House

Entry.JapaneseText: 出ていってください……
Entry.EnglishText: Please leave...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ローブだ…… ナイラさんのものか……
Entry.EnglishText: A robe... These must be Nayla's...

Entry.JapaneseText: ローブだネ。 ナイラさんのかも。
Entry.EnglishText: It's a robe. Must be Nayla's.

Entry.JapaneseText: 服がある…… ナイラさんのローブか……？
Entry.EnglishText: There are clothes... Is this Nayla's robe?

Entry.JapaneseText: ローブがありますね。 ナイラさんが 使ってたものでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: There's a robe here. Perhaps Miss Nayla must have used it?

Entry.JapaneseText: ここにあるのって、 ナイラさんのローブだよな？
Entry.EnglishText: This thing here must be Nayla's robe, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ローブ…… お母さんの……
Entry.EnglishText: Mother's robe...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>持っていきますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Take it with you? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: お母さん……
Entry.EnglishText: Mother...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『メモ書き』 文字がびっしりと書き込まれている。 書いた人の几帳面な一面が垣間見える。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Memorandum - The letters written are tightly packed together. You can see a glimpse of how methodical the writer is from the writing.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ナイラのメモ書き』 ナイラの文字でびっしりと 日々する事が書き込まれている。 ナイラの几帳面な一面が垣間見える。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Nayla's Notes - Nayla wrote her daily activities in here. You can see a glimpse of her methodical nature in her writing.

Entry.JapaneseText: お母さん……
Entry.EnglishText: Mother...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『丸っこいツボ』 中にはいい香りの液体が……
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Round Jar - There's a nice smelling liquid inside...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ツボの中身』 プラムをたっぷり使った果実酒。 なみなみと入っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Contents of the Jar - The jar is filled to the brim with plum wine that was made using many plums.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ツボの中身』 プラムをたっぷり使った果実酒。 ナイラもお酒が好きだったらしい。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Contents of the Jar - The jar is filled with a fruit wine made of many plums. It seems Nayla liked to drink this.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『丸っこいツボ』 中には漬物が入っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Round Jar - Inside lies some pickled vegetables.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ツボの中身』 パプリカの漬物。長く厳しい 冬の間の食料を確保するため この地方では漬物は欠かせない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Contents of the Jar - Pickled Paprika. In order to secure enough food for the winter, these pickled vegetables are indispensable for people in this region.
Entry.Notes: Not sure what the Paprika part is about. Paprika is spicy. Spicy keeps you warm
